snippet.title: Worms Armageddon: Anniversary Edition - PlayStation 4 Gameplay
snippet.description:
It's been twenty five years since the intrepid invertebrates flung themselves onto our screens. To celebrate this we have brought the much loved title back with Worms™ Armageddon Anniversary edition.

Re-live 1999 with this faithful rendition of Worms™ Armageddon. With all the hilarious fun and madness you know and love, based on the PC version.

New Display features to suit modern hardware. An interactive documentary about Worms Armageddon alongside a museum timeline charting the history of the series. Also included is a fully playable version of the game for the Game Boy Color.

Use over 55 classically weird and wonderful weapons and tools including Earthquake, Freeze and French Sheep Strike.

Play single-player Deathmatch plus an exciting 40+ mission campaign

Over 30 custom and comedy sound banks (including stiff upper lip, Cyberworms and more).

Beloved features from the multi-player mode: Handicapping (add or deduct energy for a team), Allied Teams (team up with others to target another player), ‘Worms Disease’, Home Runs and many, many more.

Worms, Worms Armageddon, Worms Armageddon: Anniversary Edition (C) Team17
Developed by Digital Eclipse
Also released for PlayStation 5, Xbox One, Xbox Series X|S and Nintendo Switch

#theforeseenarcade #playstation #ps4 #playstation4 #retrogaming #retro #retrogames #gaming #games #worms #team17 #wormsarmageddon #wormsarmageddonanniversaryedition #digitaleclipse 

NOTE: To avoid confusion, Team17 labelled the PSone version (which is on the PlayStation Plus Premium Classics Catalog) as "Worms Armageddon [PS1 Emulation]". The differences between the PSone version and the Anniversary Edition include the following: 4 worms per team instead of 8, maximum teams of 4, all teams share the same sound bank from the options menu, no interactive documentary or the GBC version and the PSone version has no trophy support (unless Team17 adds it to the PSone emulation via update at some point). The PSone version does retain the "Angry Scots" sound bank, which is not present in the Anniversary Edition.
